content:
• Thursday, January 5, 2012
  • WOR

    More on Worthington (WOR -3.7%): Margins narrowed despite a 28% Y/Y increase in earnings. Net...

    More on Worthington (WOR -3.7%): Margins narrowed despite a 28% Y/Y increase in earnings. Net sales took a hit from the impact of its deconsolidation of two former operations. Last year it moved its metal framing and auto-body panels businesses into joint ventures with other companies in exchange for noncontrolling stakes, which dampened revenue growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 PM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL +6.9%), which had a third of its float shorted as of Dec. 15, rallied...

    Universal Display (PANL +6.9%), which had a third of its float shorted as of Dec. 15, rallied today after KeyBanc started coverage with a Buy and $45 PT. As the broader market for OLED displays grows from $4B in 2011 to $13B in 2013, KeyBanc expects Universal's sales to rise from $60M to $200M, thanks to surging licensing revenue and materials sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:48 PM
  • DRRX

    Durect (NASDAQ:DRRX) drops 46.6% AH after stating Phase III trial results for its Posidur...

    Durect (NASDAQ:DRRX) drops 46.6% AH after stating Phase III trial results for its Posidur post-operative pain-relief drug "did not reach statistical significance." The company says it will now "hold a pre-NDA meeting with the FDA" to discuss the results. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers (WTW +8.4%) jumped after announcing deals with NYSE Euronext (NYSE:NYX) and...

    Weight Watchers (WTW +8.4%) jumped after announcing deals with NYSE Euronext (NYSE:NYX) and American Express (NYSE:AXP) that will allow employees of those companies to sign up for the program and have all or part of it paid for by their employer. The news actually came out on Jan. 3, but traders didn't seem to notice until today.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • SHPG

    ViroPharma (VPHM) says it expects 2012 sales to be above Street estimates, now expecting net...

    ViroPharma (VPHM) says it expects 2012 sales to be above Street estimates, now expecting net product sales of $600M - $660M. The analyst consensus is for total revenue of $593M. Shares +4.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • MDGL

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA) announces a secondary offering for an undisclosed amount of shares....

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA) announces a secondary offering for an undisclosed amount of shares. Jefferies is acting as sole book-running manager. Shares -11.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • SABA

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA) beats on its FQ2 EPS but misses on profit - despite a 4% increase in...

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA) beats on its FQ2 EPS but misses on profit - despite a 4% increase in revenues to $30M - due to acquistions costs. Separately, the company says it's appointed Elaine Kitagawa as its new CFO. Shares -5.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • QRVO

    RF Micro's (RFMD) warning has led to an AH selloff in rival mobile power amplifier vendors. TQNT...

    RF Micro's (RFMD) warning has led to an AH selloff in rival mobile power amplifier vendors. TQNT -3.6%. SWKS -3.9%. In addition, Chinese wireless chipmaker SPRD is down 2.1%, and RF Micro customer/2G phone giant NOK is down 0.7%. It was reported earlier today that HTC is slashing its chip orders. In addition, Credit Suisse warned of slowing mobile phone shipment growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • IART

    Integra LifeSciences (NASDAQ:IART) cuts Q4 guidance, now expecting total revenues to be around...

    Integra LifeSciences (NASDAQ:IART) cuts Q4 guidance, now expecting total revenues to be around $202M - $203M. The company attributes the revenue shortfall to inventory reduction initiatives by its instruments distributors and weaker than expected sales of its domestic extremity reconstruction products. Additionally, the company also acknowledges receiving a warning letter from the FDA following the inspection of its Plainsboro facility. Shares are halted AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • QRVO

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD) joins a growing list (I, II, III) of communications chipmakers to issue...

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD) joins a growing list (I, II, III) of communications chipmakers to issue a calendar Q4 warning. The company now expects revenue of $225M, below a consensus of $250.2M, and expects its gross margin to decline 900 bps Q/Q. RF Micro blames weak sales of chips for 2G devices to Chinese customers, as well as broad weakness in non-mobile chip sales. Shares -12.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • FDO

    Family Dollar (NYSE:FDO) reports an in-line FQ1, but the stock is weak in after hours trading as...

    Family Dollar (NYSE:FDO) reports an in-line FQ1, but the stock is weak in after hours trading as sales came in just short of estimates, largely due to the impact of higher sales of lower-margin consumables. The company reaffirms earnings guidance for FY12. Shares -3.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • VICL

    Biopharmaceutical developer Vical (NASDAQ:VICL) announces a secondary offering of an undisclosed...

    Biopharmaceutical developer Vical (NASDAQ:VICL) announces a secondary offering of an undisclosed size. Citigroup, Credit Suisse and Leerink Swann are designated as joint book-running managers. Shares -12.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • BAC

    The White House denies the rumor of a massive mortgage refinancing plan, letting the air out of...

    The White House denies the rumor of a massive mortgage refinancing plan, letting the air out of Bank of America (BAC +8.6%) shares, -2.2% AH. The chatter had sparked BofA to the top of the S&P leader board and seemed to pull the rest of the market out of the doldrums. It was the fifth straight up day for BofA shares, something that never happened in 2011. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 8 Comments
  • AA

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA) will take restructuring charges of $0.15-0.16 in Q4 as it cuts global smelting...

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA) will take restructuring charges of $0.15-0.16 in Q4 as it cuts global smelting capacity by 12% (531K metric tons) to catch up with the drop in aluminum prices, in news delivered ahead of Monday's earnings kick-off. The plans include permanent closures to three smelters in Tennessee and Texas. AA -1.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • SCVL

    Shoe Carnival (NASDAQ:SCVL) warns it expects FQ4 revenue $181M-$182M and EPS of $0.20-$0.23,...

    Shoe Carnival (NASDAQ:SCVL) warns it expects FQ4 revenue $181M-$182M and EPS of $0.20-$0.23, below Street estimates of $187M and $0.34. The company blames the results on weak boot sales, which fell 15% Y/Y at comparable stores. In addition, "increased promotional activity focused on boot sales" contributed to a 170 bps drop in Shoe Carnival's gross margin. Shares are currently halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • CHTP

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) announces a $20M secondary offering. Shares -7.4% AH.

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) announces a $20M secondary offering. Shares -7.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) gains 3.1% AH after guiding for 2012 revenue of $465M-$490M...

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) gains 3.1% AH after guiding for 2012 revenue of $465M-$490M and EPS of $4-$4.15, above a consensus of $462.8M and $3.40. The guidance takes into account Jazz's planned merger with Azur Pharma, which the companies hope to close on Jan. 16 - it's possible not all analyst forecasts took the deal into account.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • VALE

    Vale (VALE -2.7%) finishes the day in the red after UBS cut the shares to Neutral on valuation...

    Vale (VALE -2.7%) finishes the day in the red after UBS cut the shares to Neutral on valuation earlier today, citing overly high Street expectations, production volume risks and lack of catalysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • WBMD

    WebMD (WBMD +3.5%) pops after Bloomberg reports it's on a "wish list" of assets Yahoo (YHOO)...

    WebMD (WBMD +3.5%) pops after Bloomberg reports it's on a "wish list" of assets Yahoo (YHOO) wants as part of its proposed asset swap with Alibaba (OTC:ALBIY) and SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBY). Yahoo is also said to be interested in acquiring The Weather Channel (presumably for Weather.com and its mobile apps). The NY Post reported over the weekend that SoftBank has joined the bidding for WebMD.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • GEOI

    GeoResources (GEOI -3.2%) finishes the day lower after Sidoti cut the shares earlier today to...

    GeoResources (GEOI -3.2%) finishes the day lower after Sidoti cut the shares earlier today to Neutral from Buy on valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • THOR-OLD

    Thoratec (THOR-OLD -3.8%) trades down after UBS cut the shares to Neutral from Buy on valuation....

    Thoratec (THOR-OLD -3.8%) trades down after UBS cut the shares to Neutral from Buy on valuation. The firm says the stock may be played out over the near term, as peer competitor Heartware's (HTWR +1%) pending launch of HVAD is expected to cut into its heart therapy market share.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • MSFT

    Nomura's Stuart Jeffrey doesn't place much credence in a rumor that Microsoft (MSFT +0.8%) might...

    Nomura's Stuart Jeffrey doesn't place much credence in a rumor that Microsoft (MSFT +0.8%) might buy Nokia's (NOK +7%) smartphone operations. He thinks a deal only would fetch $6B-$7B, less than rival Samsung's total value. Such a move also would raise "significant" credibility issues if NOK were to go back to its Symbian software after selling the smartphone business.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • LHCG

    Shares of home-health firm LHC Group (LHCG +9.2%) are higher today on better than expected...

    Shares of home-health firm LHC Group (LHCG +9.2%) are higher today on better than expected guidance for FY12. Revenue should come in around $640M - $660M, and its EPS expected to be in the range of $1.45 - $1.65, better than Street estimates of $1.42. Separately, Coliseum Capital, a beneficial owner of the company, also recently bought an additional 22K shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • PCAR

    Orders for heavy-duty trucks rose 12% Y/Y in December and +46% from November, according to...

    Orders for heavy-duty trucks rose 12% Y/Y in December and +46% from November, according to market research firm ACT Research. Although macro-freight metrics remain mixed, December's heavy-duty order volume was the second-highest month since early 2006, and is giving a lift to trucking stocks: Paccar (PCAR +4.4%), Navistar (NAV +3%) and Cummins (CMI +2.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • USO

    Possibly taking the starch out of oil prices in the last few minutes, the FT reports Japan and...

    Possibly taking the starch out of oil prices in the last few minutes, the FT reports Japan and South Korea are busy finding new suppliers of crude to lessen their dependence on Iran. JX Nippon, Japan's largest refiner, is talking with Saudi Arabia as is the country's foreign minister, currently visiting the Middle East. WTI Crude is off $2 in the last hour to $101.80. USO -1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NUVA -2.52%) trails the market after BMO cut the shares to Market Perform. BMO cites...

    NuVasive (NUVA -2.52%) trails the market after BMO cut the shares to Market Perform. BMO cites headwinds facing the spinal-device maker in the coming year, including a tough market, regulatory hurdles, and ongoing legal concerns.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • ANDV

    Tesoro’s (TSO -7.1%) surprise warning of a Q4 loss on weaker margins slams energy stocks,...

    Tesoro’s (TSO -7.1%) surprise warning of a Q4 loss on weaker margins slams energy stocks, with Valero (VLO -3.3%) and Marathon Petroleum (MPC -5.6%) deeply in the red. Until Q4, the three refiners had been helped by a discount for crude oil because of an artificial glut caused by infrastructure constraints at Cushing, Okla., but that cost advantage has narrowed.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • GSM

    Globe Specialty Metals (GSM -9.7%) trades lower after Jefferies cut the shares to Hold and...

    Globe Specialty Metals (GSM -9.7%) trades lower after Jefferies cut the shares to Hold and lowers its EPS view. The firm cites underperformance in silicon metal alloy prices, which is likely to translate into a shortfall in FY12 earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • AOL

    AOL (AOL +3.9%) has spiked a little in afternoon trading after announcing a content distribution...

    AOL (AOL +3.9%) has spiked a little in afternoon trading after announcing a content distribution partnership with Parenting.com. Also, CEO Tim Armstrong is currently speaking at a Citi conference. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS -9%) suffers the biggest drop in the S&P 500 after reporting it added a...

    MetroPCS (PCS -9%) suffers the biggest drop in the S&P 500 after reporting it added a less-than-expected 197K net new users in Q4, down from 297K in the year-ago period; analyst consensus had predicted 223K. Churn was 3.7%, up from 3.5% a year ago. Smaller competitor Leap Wireless (LEAP -7.2%) said yesterday it added an in-line 175K subscribers in Q4.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • SSI

    Stage Stores (SSI -2.8%) trades lower despite beating December same-store sales estimates on...

    Stage Stores (SSI -2.8%) trades lower despite beating December same-store sales estimates on aggressive promotions, after the company says its Q4 gross-margin will be pressured by higher costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • PTR

    Shares of Chinese oil producers surge after China's Ministry of Finance reportedly raises the...

    Shares of Chinese oil producers surge after China's Ministry of Finance reportedly raises the threshold of its oil windfall tax to $55/barrel from $40, effective from Nov. 1 of last year. PTR +6.4%, SNP +5% CEO +7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • ARB

    Arbitron (ARB -1.8%) dips after JP Morgan cuts the shares to Neutral, citing a lack of near-term...

    Arbitron (ARB -1.8%) dips after JP Morgan cuts the shares to Neutral, citing a lack of near-term catalysts and a potential cut in its margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • MNTA

    Shares of Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA +7.7%) jump higher after the firm nabs an initiation...

    Shares of Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA +7.7%) jump higher after the firm nabs an initiation from Sanford Bernstein at Outperform. Buzz from traders tips off the big day for Dendreon may be spilling over to other biotechs.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • AEO

    American Eagle Outfitters (AEO -10.3%) trades off its earlier lows, but still takes it on the...

    American Eagle Outfitters (AEO -10.3%) trades off its earlier lows, but still takes it on the chin today after the teen apparel retailer cut its Q4 guidance. The company says weaker than anticipated demand forced it to make much more aggressive promotions to drive late holiday sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • CHH

    Choice Hotels (CHH -3.1%) lags the overall market after Baird cut the parent company of the...

    Choice Hotels (CHH -3.1%) lags the overall market after Baird cut the parent company of the Comfort Inn and Econo Lodge to Underperform on valuation, citing a shrinking development pipeline. The stock's had a solid 40% upside run since August, and Baird says there's better value in other hotel brands with much stronger growth profiles.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • AGCO

    Farm equipment maker AGCO rises 2% after CEO Martin Richenagen tells a German paper he won't...

    Farm equipment maker AGCO rises 2% after CEO Martin Richenagen tells a German paper he won't rule out a merger with a competitor such as Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT). He adds that strong demand will lift AGCO's 2012 revenue to $10B, which compares favorably with a $9.8B consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • RECN

    Resources Connection (RECN -7.9%) gets hit hard after its FQ2 earnings missed both revenue and...

    Resources Connection (RECN -7.9%) gets hit hard after its FQ2 earnings missed both revenue and EPS estimates. Profit rose 45% Y/Y, primarily due to a favorable accounting adjustment, but gross margin fell to 37.9% from 39.5% amid higher direct costs of services.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • BA

    Boeing (BA -1.1%) reports an order for 25 of the firm's 787 Dreamliner planes, pushing orders...

    Boeing (BA -1.1%) reports an order for 25 of the firm's 787 Dreamliner planes, pushing orders for 2011 into positive territory after cancellations were recorded earlier in the year. Trying to take the sting out of just coming off its 9th consecutive loss to Airbus in terms of net orders, execs with the firm have declared 2012 the "Year of the 737 MAX."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • SNE

    Doug McIntyre speculates Sony (SNE -3.1%) could be a viable partner for Barnes & Noble...

    Doug McIntyre speculates Sony (SNE -3.1%) could be a viable partner for Barnes & Noble (BKS -21.7%) and take a large equity position in a Nook spinoff. If the $750M 2012 sales forecast for BKS digital content is right, a Nook company could be worth $3B-$4B. BKS shareholders could retain a majority interest in Nook, which "may be more worth more than Barnes & Noble is in its entirety today."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • SODA

    SodaStream (SODA +5.4%) CEO Daniel Birnbaum tells CNBC that American consumers are ready for...

    SodaStream (SODA +5.4%) CEO Daniel Birnbaum tells CNBC that American consumers are ready for "fizzling" ice tea and lemonade after seeing the dramatic results in global markets when carbonation was added to popular drinks. The new partnership between his firm and Kraft (KFT +1%) allows consumers to use the SodaStream carbonation model to produce versions of Country Time lemonade and Crystal Light iced tea.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • HELE

    Helen of Troy (HELE +2.4%) is higher today after its FQ3 earnings beat estimates on a surge in...

    Helen of Troy (HELE +2.4%) is higher today after its FQ3 earnings beat estimates on a surge in revenue. Profit rose 21% Y/Y - despite a decline in margins on higher overhead costs - as its top line was boosted by the recent acquisition of Kaz Inc. and its purchase of the PUR water purification-products business from Procter & Gamble.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • CHE

    A Bloomberg report about the Justice Department joining a lawsuit against another hospice...

    A Bloomberg report about the Justice Department joining a lawsuit against another hospice operator may be contributing to weakness in Chemed (CHE -1.9%) shares. DOJ and the Department of Health and Human Services are already investigating Chemed’s Vitas Healthcare, for “an extensive scheme” to defraud the government of “hundreds of millions of dollars."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • BAC

    Citigroup's Keith Horowitz reiterates a Buy rating on Bank of America (BAC +5.5%), writing that...

    Citigroup's Keith Horowitz reiterates a Buy rating on Bank of America (BAC +5.5%), writing that up to an additional $32B could be needed to address mortgage-related losses, but "when you factor in the earnings power and the time it will take to resolve these issues, it appears to be manageable." Shares are already pricing in a large equity offering, Horowitz adds.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • GSS

    Golden Star Resources (GSS -2.2%) trades down after its preliminary Q4 production results for...

    Golden Star Resources (GSS -2.2%) trades down after its preliminary Q4 production results for two operations came in below guidance, primarily due to a shutdown and isolated production problems. The company was recently forced to shut down its Bogoso/Prestea sulfide plant for maintenance work, and its Wassa/HBB production was impacted throughout the quarter by wet oxide ores, which caused machine blockages.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • CEB

    Corporate Executive Board (EXBD -4.7%) trades lower after BofA takes its rating on shares all...

    Corporate Executive Board (EXBD -4.7%) trades lower after BofA takes its rating on shares all the way down to Underperform from Buy. Also weighing on shares is a filing (8-K) with the SEC indicating the firm will take a charge in Q4 related to the sale of Toolbox.com.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • DEST

    Maternity-apparel retailer Destination Maternity (DEST -10%) takes a hit after saying it expects...

    Maternity-apparel retailer Destination Maternity (DEST -10%) takes a hit after saying it expects to post FQ1 earnings at or slightly below the low end of its targeted range due to excessive markdowns in its attempt to spur sales and manage inventory. Despite the agressive pricing strategy, comparable sales still dipped 4.1% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • ASNA

    Ascena Retail (ASNA +4.7%) rallies after announcing its December same-store sales rose 14% Y/Y,...

    Ascena Retail (ASNA +4.7%) rallies after announcing its December same-store sales rose 14% Y/Y, thanks to a 19% increase for its Justice brand, and a 12% increase for its dressbarn brand. As a result, the company is raising its FY12 (ends in April) EPS guidance to a range of $2.70-$2.70, above a prior range of $2.55-$2.65.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NVDA +2.4%) is Needham's top pick among big chip makers for consumer electronics and...

    Nvidia (NVDA +2.4%) is Needham's top pick among big chip makers for consumer electronics and computers. After disappointing sales of tablet computers, which hurt sales of Nvidia’s Tegra application processor, Needham believes the stock has now baked in modest expectations for Tegra. The firm’s top pick among small caps is Silicon Motion (SIMO +2.1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • CAST

    Much-maligned ChinaCast Education (OTCPK:CAST -2.4%) (previous) says it will be filing an 8-K...

    Much-maligned ChinaCast Education (OTCPK:CAST -2.4%) (previous) says it will be filing an 8-K with the SEC to restate financial results in 2010 in order to reverse a write-off of certain prepayments.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • SNCR

    Synchronoss (SNCR -3.5%) sells off after announcing it's acquiring Miyowa, a developer of social...

    Synchronoss (SNCR -3.5%) sells off after announcing it's acquiring Miyowa, a developer of social networking and messaging software for mobile devices, for $45.5M + up to $13.5M in milestone payments. Miyowa's software complements Synchronoss' solutions for activating mobile devices and provisioning content/services. The company expects the deal to be "at least neutral" to its 2012 EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • BEBE

    Bebe (OTC:BEBE -2.8%) trades lower after reporting FQ2 sales growth that missed targets. Retail...

    Bebe (OTC:BEBE -2.8%) trades lower after reporting FQ2 sales growth that missed targets. Retail sales for the quarter rose just 9.9% to $141M, missing Street expectations of $147M, and, despite saying it expects to meet the high end of its guidance range at $0.07 per share, analysts had been looking for more.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • LSI-OLD

    LSI (LSI-OLD +7.2%) tops the S&P leader board after Wedbush raises its rating on the stock...

    LSI (LSI-OLD +7.2%) tops the S&P leader board after Wedbush raises its rating on the stock to Outperform and lifts its price target to $8.50 from $7. Wedbush sees LSI benefiting from Seagate’s (STX +4.8%) better-than-expected sales and its own recent acquisition of chip tech company SandForce.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • TTWO

    MKM Partners upgrades Take-Two (TTWO +3.8%) to Buy with a price target raised to $20 from...

    MKMPartners upgrades Take-Two (TTWO +3.8%) to Buy with a price target raised to $20 from $16 and a $3.05 FY2013 (Mar.) EPS estimate vs. a prior $2.39 outlook. MKM says TTWO should have a strong release slate in the coming year, including Grand Theft Auto V, and should benefit from the expiration of its costly licensing deal with Major League Baseball.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • GEVA

    Shares of Synageva BioPharma (NASDAQ:GEVA) reverse an AH decline yesterday that followed its...

    Shares of Synageva BioPharma (NASDAQ:GEVA) reverse an AH decline yesterday that followed its announcement of a $60M stock offering, gaining 12.8% today to touch 52-week highs.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • CMC

    Carl Icahn says he's willing to raise his $15-per-share bid for Commercial Metals (CMC -1.2%)...

    Carl Icahn says he's willing to raise his $15-per-share bid for Commercial Metals (CMC -1.2%) and encourages shareholders to accept his unsolicited $1.73B tender offer for the scrap-metal processor. Icahn says if the shares are tendered and the board puts the company up for sale, he's willing to extend his offer to allow for a competitive sales process with a $15 floor.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • STZ

    Constellation Brands (STZ -5.6%) takes a hit after its FQ3 earnings miss the mark on dwindling...

    Constellation Brands (STZ -5.6%) takes a hit after its FQ3 earnings miss the mark on dwindling sales and higher promotional expenses. Profit dropped 25% Y/Y as the alcoholic beverage distributor posted a 27% Y/Y decline in sales, due in large part to the divestiture of its Australian and U.K. wine businesses and overly cautious consumer spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • KODK

    One benefit to a Chapter 11 filing for Kodak (EK -8.7%) would be saving the company from pension...

    One benefit to a Chapter 11 filing for Kodak (EK -8.7%) would be saving the company from pension obligations that run into the hundreds of millions of dollars a year. “Companies such as Kodak and [GM] bought labor peace by committing to ever-more generous benefits, certain that revenue would continue to grow and failing to address the re-emergence of hungry competitors abroad.”
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 6 Comments
  • ARO

    Shares of Aeropostale (ARO +4.5%) gain after the firm bucks the trend of retailers issuing lower...

    Shares of Aeropostale (ARO +4.5%) gain after the firm bucks the trend of retailers issuing lower guidance, as it reiterates Q4 EPS in a range of $0.35-$0.38 even though its same-store sales fell off 10% in December.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • BONT

    Bon-Ton Stores (OTC:BONT -8.2%) trades lower after the company widened its loss estimate for...

    Bon-Ton Stores (OTC:BONT -8.2%) trades lower after the company widened its loss estimate for FY11 due to unseasonably mild weather hurting its December sales. It now expects to post a loss between $1.00 - $1.30 per share, compared with its November guidance for a loss of $0.65 to a profit of $0.25 a share. Same-store sales for December fell 0.7% while total sales dropped 1.1% to $505M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • STX

    Seagate's (STX +5.8%) strong FQ2/FQ3 guidance is triggering a broader rally in makers of storage...

    Seagate's (STX +5.8%) strong FQ2/FQ3 guidance is triggering a broader rally in makers of storage drives - both hard drives and solid-state drives - as investors eagerly anticipate a 1H environment of strong pricing and high margins. WDC +6.6%. OCZ +5.4%. STEC +4.4%. SNDK +1.1%. At a valuation of just 3x its estimated FY13 (ends June '13) EPS, Needham thinks Seagate is still dirt cheap.
